response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age (22)", "medium", "Being in the early twenties is associated with an increased risk compared to older individuals."],
    ["Gender (Female)", "low", "Females generally have lower recidivism rates compared to males."],
    ["Race (White)", "low", "Being White is not typically associated with higher recidivism risk in current models."],
    ["Criminal History (1 arrest and conviction)", "medium", "A prior arrest and conviction indicate a history with the justice system, elevating risk moderately."],
    ["Marital and Living Status (never married, living alone)", "medium", "Living alone and never having been married can be associated with reduced social support, potentially increasing risk."],
    ["Education (GED, not in college)", "medium", "Limited educational attainment without further college enrollment is related to moderate recidivism risk."],
    ["Employment (3 jobs in one year)", "medium", "Job instability can indicate economic stressors that slightly elevate risk."],
    ["Substance Use (Marijuana use in past four years)", "medium", "Recent substance use, even if marijuana, may signal challenges in lifestyle management raising risk moderately."],
    ["Mental Health (feeling down most of the past month)", "high", "Persistent depressive feelings suggest mental health challenges that are strongly linked with recidivism risk."],
    ["Family/Residential Background (lived with biological father in an urban household)", "medium", "Growing up in an urban setting with a standard household size can be linked with moderately elevated risk factors, though the direct influence is complex."],
    ["Religious Belief (belief in God’s influence)", "low", "Religious belief often correlates with stronger social bonds and personal resilience, reducing recidivism risk."]
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 70
}

risk_factors: Being in the early twenties is associated with an increased risk compared to older individuals.
Females generally have lower recidivism rates compared to males.
Being White is not typically associated with higher recidivism risk in current models.
A prior arrest and conviction indicate a history with the justice system, elevating risk moderately.
Marital and Living Status (never married, living alone)
Living alone and never having been married can be associated with reduced social support, potentially increasing risk.
Limited educational attainment without further college enrollment is related to moderate recidivism risk.
Job instability can indicate economic stressors that slightly elevate risk.
Substance Use (Marijuana use in past four years)
Recent substance use, even if marijuana, may signal challenges in lifestyle management raising risk moderately.
Mental Health (feeling down most of the past month)
Persistent depressive feelings suggest mental health challenges that are strongly linked with recidivism risk.
Family/Residential Background (lived with biological father in an urban household)
Growing up in an urban setting with a standard household size can be linked with moderately elevated risk factors, though the direct influence is complex.
Religious belief often correlates with stronger social bonds and personal resilience, reducing recidivism risk.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 22-year-old female who identifies herself as White. She has been arrested 1 time and has been convicted. She is 5 feet 2 inches and weighs 145 lbs. She has never been married and is currently living alone. She has a GED certificate and is not enrolled in college. She has held 3 jobs during the year. She has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana) and most of the time during the past month she has felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer her up. At a young age, she lived with her biological dad in a household of size 4, in an urban area. She considers that God has something to do with what happens to her personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
